text: Supreme Court clears way for California voting map that bolsters Democrats - The Washington Post
fullText: The Supreme Court allowed a new California voting map that could help Democrats gain up to five seats in Congress.

fullText: E.l.f. Beauty said its acquisition of Hailey Bieber's skin-care company, Rhode, contributed $128 million to the company's net third-quarter sales growth.

text: Mandelson offered to help Epstein get Russian visa, documents suggest - BBC
fullText: Emails released by the US government suggest the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein planned to use the visa to meet young women in Moscow.

text: With latest Minnesota fraud case looming, the lead prosecutors have quit - CBS News
fullText: The four prosecutors who spearheaded a $250 million Minnesota fraud case have all left the U.S. Attorney's Office in a growing wave of resignations.

text: Moltbook is the newest social media platform — but it’s just for AI bots - NPR
fullText: A new message board for artificial intelligence agents has prompted some strange conversations, and existential questions about the inner lives of bots.

text: Regulatory grammar in human promoters uncovered by MPRA-based deep learning - Nature
fullText: PARM is a deep-learning model trained on data from massively parallel reporter assays to help predict promoter activity in different human cell types, design synthetic promoters and identify key features of regulatory promoter grammar.

text: Israel strikes across Gaza, killing 24, and says militants attacked its soldiers - AP News

text: First Winter Olympics Event Was Halted Within Moments - Newser
fullText: Curling matches resumed after a brief power outage in Cortina

text: UFC's Jones needs hip replaced, still wants fight at White House - ESPN
fullText: UFC star Jon Jones said he's in need of a hip replacement, but he is still interested in competing at the UFC's White House event scheduled for June.

fullText: "We told them it is this or nothing, and they said, 'Ok, then nothing.'"

text: Synthesizing scientific literature with retrieval-augmented language models - Nature
fullText: A specialized, open-source, retrieval-augmented language model is introduced for answering scientific queries and synthesizing literature, the responses of which are shown to be preferred by human evaluations over expert-written answers.

text: Trump's Kennedy Center closure shocks the National Symphony Orchestra - NBC News
fullText: President Donald Trump’s decision to close the Kennedy Center for two years starting this summer came with no notice to the National Symphony Orchestra.

text: Spotify launches offline lyrics, translations, and lyric previews - The Verge
fullText: Spotify is expanding lyric translations to all users worldwide and introducing lyric previews, along with offline lyrics for Spotify Premium users.

text: January 2026 Google Play system update just turned into November 2025? You're not alone - Android Authority
fullText: Android users report a Google Play system update bug that downgrades them from January 2026 version to November 2025. Here is what we know!

text: Patriots Rematch Digs Up Memories for Seahawks Who Lost 11 Years Ago - Sports Illustrated
fullText: Many Legion of Boom–era players had put Super Bowl XLIX behind them, but old feelings are bubbling up. Plus, memories of 2015 in Greg Bishop’s newsletter.
